properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 1:40PM PST until February 10 at 4:45PM PST by NWS Phoenix AZ
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a

* Flood Advisory for Minor Flooding in Poor Drainage Areas for...
Southwestern Imperial County in southeastern California...

* Until 445 PM PST.

* At 139 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain that
will cause minor flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will
result in minor flooding in the advisory area. Falling rocks on
area roads have also been a problem. Up to three quarters of an
inch of rain has already fallen.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
El Centro, Calexico, Imperial, Plaster City, Ocotillo, Mt. Signal,
El Centro Naval Airfield, Heber, Coyote Wells, Dixieland and
Seeley.
properties.instruction:
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.
